Changelog
  </h1>
</div>
<p>All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. See <a href="https://github.com/conventional-changelog/standard-version">standard-version</a> for commit guidelines.</p>

  <h2>
    <a href="#unreleased" name="unreleased" class="pilcrow"></a>

  </h2>
</div>
<div class="pilwrap" id="17.2.3-2025-09-29">
  <h2>
    <a href="#17.2.3-2025-09-29" name="17.2.3-2025-09-29" class="pilcrow"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/compare/v17.2.2...v17.2.3">17.2.3</a> (2025-09-29)
  </h2>
</div>
<div class="pilwrap" id="changed">
  <h3>
    <a href="#changed" name="changed" class="pilcrow"></a>
Changed
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Fixed typescript error definition (<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/pull/912">#912</a>)</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="17.2.2-2025-09-02">
  <h2>
    <a href="#17.2.2-2025-09-02" name="17.2.2-2025-09-02" class="pilcrow"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/compare/v17.2.1...v17.2.2">17.2.2</a> (2025-09-02)
  </h2>
</div>
<div class="pilwrap" id="added">
  <h3>
    <a href="#added" name="added" class="pilcrow"></a>
Added
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li> A big thank you to new sponsor <a href="https://tuple.app/dotenv">Tuple.app</a> - <em>the premier screen sharing app for developers on macOS and Windows.</em> Go check them out. It's wonderful and generous of them to give back to open source by sponsoring dotenv. Give them some love back.</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="17.2.1-2025-07-24">
  <h2>
    <a href="#17.2.1-2025-07-24" name="17.2.1-2025-07-24" class="pilcrow"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/compare/v17.2.0...v17.2.1">17.2.1</a> (2025-07-24)
  </h2>
</div>
<div class="pilwrap" id="changed-1">
  <h3>
    <a href="#changed-1" name="changed-1" class="pilcrow"></a>
Changed
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Fix clickable tip links by removing parentheses (<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/pull/897">#897</a>)</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="17.2.0-2025-07-09">
  <h2>
    <a href="#17.2.0-2025-07-09" name="17.2.0-2025-07-09" class="pilcrow"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/compare/v17.1.0...v17.2.0">17.2.0</a> (2025-07-09)
  </h2>
</div>
<div class="pilwrap" id="added-1">
  <h3>
    <a href="#added-1" name="added-1" class="pilcrow"></a>
Added
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Optionally specify <code>DOTENV_CONFIG_QUIET=true</code> in your environment or <code>.env</code> file to quiet the runtime log (<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/pull/889">#889</a>)</li>
<li>Just like dotenv any <code>DOTENV_CONFIG_</code> environment variables take precedence over any code set options like <code>({quiet: false})</code></li>
</ul>
<pre><code class="ini"><span class="hljs-comment"># .env</span>
<span class="hljs-attr">DOTENV_CONFIG_QUIET</span>=<span class="hljs-literal">true</span>
<span class="hljs-attr">HELLO</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"World"</span>
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="js"><span class="hljs-comment">// index.js</span>
<span class="hljs-built_in">require</span>(<span class="hljs-string">'dotenv'</span>).config()
<span class="hljs-built_in">console</span>.log(<span class="hljs-string">`Hello <span class="hljs-subst">${process.env.HELLO}</span>`</span>)
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="sh">$ node index.js
Hello World

or

$ DOTENV_CONFIG_QUIET=<span class="hljs-literal">true</span> node index.js
</code></pre>
<div class="pilwrap" id="17.1.0-2025-07-07">
  <h2>
    <a href="#17.1.0-2025-07-07" name="17.1.0-2025-07-07" class="pilcrow"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/compare/v17.0.1...v17.1.0">17.1.0</a> (2025-07-07)
  </h2>
</div>
<div class="pilwrap" id="added-2">
  <h3>
    <a href="#added-2" name="added-2" class="pilcrow"></a>
Added
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Add additional security and configuration tips to the runtime log (<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/pull/884">#884</a>)</li>
<li>Dim the tips text from the main injection information text</li>
</ul>
<pre><code class="js"><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span> TIPS = [
  <span class="hljs-string">' encrypt with dotenvx: https://dotenvx.com'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-string">' prevent committing .env to code: https://dotenvx.com/precommit'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-string">' prevent building .env in docker: https://dotenvx.com/prebuild'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-string">'  run anywhere with `dotenvx run -- yourcommand`'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-string">'  specify custom .env file path with { path: \'/custom/path/.env\' }'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-string">'  enable debug logging with { debug: true }'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-string">'  override existing env vars with { override: true }'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-string">'  suppress all logs with { quiet: true }'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-string">'  write to custom object with { processEnv: myObject }'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-string">'  load multiple .env files with { path: [\'.env.local\', \'.env\'] }'</span>
]
</code></pre>

<div class="pilwrap" id="16.6.1-2025-06-27">
  <h2>
    <a href="#16.6.1-2025-06-27" name="16.6.1-2025-06-27" class="pilcrow"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/compare/v16.6.0...v16.6.1">16.6.1</a> (2025-06-27)
  </h2>
</div>
<div class="pilwrap" id="changed-4">
  <h3>
    <a href="#changed-4" name="changed-4" class="pilcrow"></a>
Changed
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Default <code>quiet</code> to true  hiding the runtime log message (<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/pull/874">#874</a>)</li>
<li>NOTICE: 17.0.0 will be released with quiet defaulting to false. Use <code>config({ quiet: true })</code> to suppress.</li>
<li>And check out the new <a href="https://github.com/dotenvx/dotenvx">dotenvx</a>. As coding workflows evolve and agents increasingly handle secrets, encrypted .env files offer a much safer way to deploy both agents and code together with secure secrets. Simply switch <code>require('dotenv').config()</code> for <code>require('@dotenvx/dotenvx').config()</code>.</li>
</ul>

<div class="pilwrap" id="16.1.3-2023-05-31">
  <h2>
    <a href="#16.1.3-2023-05-31" name="16.1.3-2023-05-31" class="pilcrow"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/compare/v16.1.2...v16.1.3">16.1.3</a> (2023-05-31)
  </h2>
</div>
<div class="pilwrap" id="removed">
  <h3>
    <a href="#removed" name="removed" class="pilcrow"></a>
Removed
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Removed <code>browser</code> keys for <code>path</code>, <code>os</code>, and <code>crypto</code> in package.json. These were set to false incorrectly as of 16.1. Instead, if using dotenv on the front-end make sure to include polyfills for <code>path</code>, <code>os</code>, and <code>crypto</code>. <a href="https://github.com/Richienb/node-polyfill-webpack-plugin">node-polyfill-webpack-plugin</a> provides these.</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="16.1.2-2023-05-31">
  <h2>
    <a href="#16.1.2-2023-05-31" name="16.1.2-2023-05-31" class="pilcrow"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/compare/v16.1.1...v16.1.2">16.1.2</a> (2023-05-31)
  </h2>
</div>

    <a href="#changed-13" name="changed-13" class="pilcrow"></a>

</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="16.1.1-2023-05-30">
  <h2>
    <a href="#16.1.1-2023-05-30" name="16.1.1-2023-05-30" class="pilcrow"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/compare/v16.1.0...v16.1.1">16.1.1</a> (2023-05-30)
  </h2>

<div class="pilwrap" id="16.1.0-2023-05-30">
  <h2>
    <a href="#16.1.0-2023-05-30" name="16.1.0-2023-05-30" class="pilcrow"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/compare/v16.0.3...v16.1.0">16.1.0</a> (2023-05-30)
  </h2>
</div>
<div class="pilwrap" id="added-11">
  <h3>
    <a href="#added-11" name="added-11" class="pilcrow"></a>
Added
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Add <code>populate</code> convenience method <a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/pull/733">#733</a></li>
<li>Accept URL as path option <a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/pull/720">#720</a></li>
<li>Add dotenv to <code>npm fund</code> command</li>
<li>Spanish language README <a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/pull/698">#698</a></li>
<li>Add <code>.env.vault</code> support.  (<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/pull/730">#730</a>)</li>
</ul>
<p> <code>.env.vault</code> extends the <code>.env</code> file format standard with a localized encrypted vault file. Package it securely with your production code deploys. It's cloud agnostic so that you can deploy your secrets anywhere without <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2023/01/05/circleci-breach/">risky third-party integrations</a>. <a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv#-deploying">read more</a></p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="changed-15">
  <h3>
    <a href="#changed-15" name="changed-15" class="pilcrow"></a>
Changed
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Fixed &quot;cannot resolve 'fs'&quot; error on tools like Replit <a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/pull/693">#693</a></li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="16.0.3-2022-09-29">
  <h2>
    <a href="#16.0.3-2022-09-29" name="16.0.3-2022-09-29" class="pilcrow"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/compare/v16.0.2...v16.0.3">16.0.3</a> (2022-09-29)

<div class="pilwrap" id="16.0.0-2022-02-02">
  <h2>
    <a href="#16.0.0-2022-02-02" name="16.0.0-2022-02-02" class="pilcrow"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/compare/v15.0.1...v16.0.0">16.0.0</a> (2022-02-02)
  </h2>
</div>
<div class="pilwrap" id="added-13">
  <h3>
    <a href="#added-13" name="added-13" class="pilcrow"></a>
Added
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>

</ul>
<p>If you had values containing the backtick character, please quote those values with either single or double quotes.</p>

  <h2>

<div class="pilwrap" id="15.0.0-2022-01-31">
  <h2>
    <a href="#15.0.0-2022-01-31" name="15.0.0-2022-01-31" class="pilcrow"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/compare/v14.3.2...v15.0.0">15.0.0</a> (2022-01-31)
  </h2>
</div>
<p><code>v15.0.0</code> is a major new release with some important breaking changes.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="added-14">
  <h3>
    <a href="#added-14" name="added-14" class="pilcrow"></a>
Added
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li><em>Breaking:</em> Multiline parsing support (just works. no need for the flag.)</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="changed-19">
  <h3>
    <a href="#changed-19" name="changed-19" class="pilcrow"></a>
Changed
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li><em>Breaking:</em> <code>#</code> marks the beginning of a comment (UNLESS the value is wrapped in quotes. Please update your <code>.env</code> files to wrap in quotes any values containing <code>#</code>. For example: <code>SECRET_HASH=&quot;something-with-a-#-hash&quot;</code>).</li>
</ul>
<p>..Understandably, (as some teams have noted) this is tedious to do across the entire team. To make it less tedious, we recommend using <a href="https://github.com/dotenv-org/cli">dotenv cli</a> going forward. It's an optional plugin that will keep your <code>.env</code> files in sync between machines, environments, or team members.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="removed-1">
  <h3>
    <a href="#removed-1" name="removed-1" class="pilcrow"></a>
Removed
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li><em>Breaking:</em> Remove multiline option (just works out of the box now. no need for the flag.)</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="14.3.2-2022-01-25">

    <a href="#14.3.2-2022-01-25" name="14.3.2-2022-01-25" class="pilcrow"></a>

<div class="pilwrap" id="5.0.0-2018-01-29">
  <h2>
    <a href="#5.0.0-2018-01-29" name="5.0.0-2018-01-29" class="pilcrow"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/compare/v4.0.0...v5.0.0">5.0.0</a> - 2018-01-29
  </h2>
</div>
<div class="pilwrap" id="added-28">
  <h3>
    <a href="#added-28" name="added-28" class="pilcrow"></a>
Added
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Testing against Node v8 and v9</li>
<li>Documentation on trim behavior of values</li>
<li>Documentation on how to use with <code>import</code></li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="changed-38">
  <h3>
    <a href="#changed-38" name="changed-38" class="pilcrow"></a>
Changed
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li><em>Breaking</em>: default <code>path</code> is now <code>path.resolve(process.cwd(), '.env')</code></li>
<li><em>Breaking</em>: does not write over keys already in <code>process.env</code> if the key has a falsy value</li>
<li>using <code>const</code> and <code>let</code> instead of <code>var</code></li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="removed-4">
  <h3>
    <a href="#removed-4" name="removed-4" class="pilcrow"></a>
Removed
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Testing against Node v7</li>
</ul>

<div class="pilwrap" id="3.0.0-2016-12-20">
  <h2>
    <a href="#3.0.0-2016-12-20" name="3.0.0-2016-12-20" class="pilcrow"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/compare/v2.0.0...v3.0.0">3.0.0</a> - 2016-12-20
  </h2>
</div>
<div class="pilwrap" id="added-29">
  <h3>
    <a href="#added-29" name="added-29" class="pilcrow"></a>
Added
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li><code>verbose</code> option will log any error messages. Off by default.</li>
<li>parses email addresses correctly</li>
<li>allow importing config method directly in ES6</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="changed-40">
  <h3>
    <a href="#changed-40" name="changed-40" class="pilcrow"></a>
Changed
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Suppress error messages by default (<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/pull/154">#154</a>)</li>
<li>Ignoring more files for NPM to make package download smaller</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="fixed-1">
  <h3>
    <a href="#fixed-1" name="fixed-1" class="pilcrow"></a>
Fixed
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li>False positive test due to case-sensitive variable (<a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv/pull/124">#124</a>)</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="removed-6">
  <h3>
    <a href="#removed-6" name="removed-6" class="pilcrow"></a>
Removed
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li><code>silent</code> option removed in favor of <code>verbose</code></li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="2.0.0-2016-01-20">
  <h2>
    <a href="#2.0.0-2016-01-20" name="2.0.0-2016-01-20" class="pilcrow"></a>

  </h2>

<div class="pilwrap" id="added-30">
  <h3>
    <a href="#added-30" name="added-30" class="pilcrow"></a>
Added
  </h3>
</div>
<ul>
<li>CHANGELOG to <a href="http://keepachangelog.com/">&quot;make it easier for users and contributors to see precisely what notable changes have been made between each release&quot;</a>. Linked to from README</li>
<li>LICENSE to be more explicit about what was defined in <code>package.json</code>. Linked to from README</li>
<li>Testing nodejs v4 on travis-ci</li>
<li>added examples of how to use dotenv in different ways</li>
<li>return parsed object on success rather than boolean true</li>
</ul>
